references.paper_title: Measuring robustness to natural distribution shifts in image classification
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the study of distribution shifts, a key aspect of extrapolation, making it highly relevant to the current research.

references.paper_title: Wilds: A benchmark of in-the-wild distribution shifts
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive benchmark dataset for evaluating generalization under distribution shifts which is directly relevant to the problem of extrapolation.

This paper introduces a framework for partial disentanglement which directly addresses the challenges faced when dealing with out-of-distribution samples and is highly relevant to the study of extrapolation.

This paper introduces a practical test-time adaptation approach using masked autoencoders, which is highly relevant to the problem of extrapolation and is directly used for comparison in this research.

references.paper_title: TeSLA: Test-time self-learning with automatic adversarial augmentation
references.reason: This paper proposes a state-of-the-art test-time adaptation method that directly addresses the issue of adapting to out-of-distribution samples, serving as a strong baseline for comparison.
